name: Monthly Retention & Attrition Analysis
description: Analyze monthly member/customer retention and attrition trends, identify root causes for churn, and create actionable insights for leadership. Includes variance analysis against targets and recommendations for retention initiatives.

currentProcess.description: Pull retention data from multiple sources (CRM, billing system, membership database)
painPoints: Date range alignment issues between sources

currentProcess.description: Clean and consolidate data into analysis spreadsheet
painPoints: Column formats don't match between sources
Missing data requires follow-up with other teams

currentProcess.description: Calculate retention metrics (retention rate, churn rate, cohort analysis)
painPoints: Cohort definitions change quarter to quarter

currentProcess.description: Compare against targets and prior periods, identify variances
Investigate root causes for significant variances
painPoints: Need to interview stakeholders for context
Causation vs correlation is hard to prove

currentProcess.description: Create PowerPoint with findings and recommendations
painPoints: Formatting takes as long as analysis
Stakeholders want different levels of detail

currentProcess.description: Write executive summary and talking points
painPoints: Condensing 8 hours of work into 1 page is hard
Getting the tone right for the audience

currentProcess.description: Review, revise based on feedback, finalize

aiProcess.description: Pull and consolidate data from sources
aiProcess.toolRationale: Gemini handles structured data well and can identify inconsistencies across sources
aiProcess.expectedOutput: Clean, consolidated dataset with flagged discrepancies
tips: Export each source as CSV first
Include date ranges in file names to avoid confusion
Keep raw data separate from processed data

aiProcess.toolRationale: Gemini can perform calculations and explain what the numbers mean in plain English
aiProcess.expectedOutput: Metrics table with variance analysis and initial hypotheses
tips: Provide target values in your prompt
Ask for both the math and the 'so what'
Request confidence levels for variance explanations

aiProcess.description: Generate root cause hypotheses and investigation plan
aiProcess.toolRationale: Claude excels at structured reasoning and generating multiple hypotheses
aiProcess.expectedOutput: Ranked list of potential causes with investigation steps for each
tips: Provide context about recent business changes
Ask for both internal and external factors

aiProcess.toolRationale: Human judgment needed, but AI can help structure your questions

aiProcess.description: Draft report with findings and recommendations
aiProcess.toolRationale: ChatGPT writes clear, professional narratives quickly
aiProcess.expectedOutput: Draft report with sections: summary, trends, root causes, recommendations
tips: Specify your audience (CEO vs. team leads)
Ask for executive summary first, then details

aiProcess.toolRationale: Use AI for quick edits and rewrites; human review for accuracy
aiProcess.expectedOutput: Final polished report ready for presentation
tips: Read the AI draft critically - don't accept blindly
Check all numbers against source data
Add your expert commentary where needed

whyItMatters: Retention directly impacts revenue. At AAA, a 1% improvement in retention rate = ~$2.7M in saved revenue annually. Fast, accurate analysis means faster action on at-risk segments.
commonMistakes: Using AI-generated numbers without validation - always check the math
Forgetting to include context about business changes (price increases, new products)
Over-relying on AI for causation - it can suggest, but you need to verify
Skipping the stakeholder validation step - AI doesn't know what happened last month
Creating recommendations without considering implementation feasibility
tips: Keep a running doc of 'things that happened this month' to feed into AI context
Build a template prompt that you update each month with new data
Use AI to generate 3 versions of recommendations - conservative, moderate, aggressive
Ask AI to poke holes in your analysis before presenting to leadership

McKinsey Operations Practice - Retention analysis frameworks
Aditya Goyal AAA Experience - $27M retention initiative management
